IT Service Desk Officer Job at AB Microfinance Bank Nigeria




        
    

        
        AB Microfinance Bank Nigeria is committed to its passion of helping to improve the business opportunities of entrepreneurs by availing them of easy access to affordable loans, as well as improve the general financial status of everyone with its deposit accounts. It is a limited liability company duly incorporated in Nigeria under the 2002 Companies and Allied Matters Act, and is regulated by the Central Bank of Nigeria as a fully fledged microfinance bank.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



The Bank has an exceptional group of very strong international shareholders committed to the task of improving access to financial services in the country. These shareholders are Access Microfinance Holding AG of Germany, KfW - the German Development Bank, the African Development Bank, and the International Finance Corporation of the World Bank Group. Together, they have an established record of setting up and managing microfinance banks across the African and Asian continents in such countries as Nigeria, Tanzania, Liberia, Zambia, Rwanda, Madagascar, Azerbaijan, Tajikistan,Georgia and Brazil.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Service Desk Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Responsibilities


	1st line support for staff on service requests and incidents
	Escalate unresolved issues/requests to 2nd Line in a timely manner
	Ensure continuity of banking operations via high quality customer service
	Assist with on-boarding of new users, movement, leave plan, and exit of staff
	Assist in maintaining inventory of all equipment and related stock
	Ensure compliance to operating procedures
	IT Service Management SLA meetup
	Periodic branch visitation for IT routine activities.
	Installation of software on systems and servers for branches and Head Office
	Maintenance of File Server and user rights
	Assign users and computers to proper groups in Active Directory
	User and profile maintenance on the Active Directory
	Installation & Update Maintenance of Anti-virus software for all users
	Windows Patch and Anti-Virus Updates for all computer hardware
	Perform timely workstation hardware and software upgrades as required
	IT Asset Management (ITAM)
	Proper inventory of all IT assets including mobile tablet.


Requirements


	Minimum educational qualification of B.Sc./HND in Computer Science or any related field
	Cognate Experience in a business environment and at least three years of relevant experience
	In-depth knowledge of technical hardware, Microsoft Operating System and Office Suite software (MS 2019-2022), and other productivity tools
	Proficient in troubleshooting issues relating to hardware and software
	Soft skills: results-driven (meeting service levels), effective communication, problem solving
	Basic ITIL knowledge would be of advantage
	I.T Certification will be an added advantage (Microsoft, Linux)
	Ability to work with minimum supervision.
	Demonstrates drive, enthusiasm, self-motivation and professionalism.
	Ability to manage competing priorities, maintain attention to details and meet deadlines.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Fleet Officer - Activation / Documentation Job at Max Drive




        
    

        
        Max Drive - We are a team of passionate people and a leading technology-enabled company driven by a vision to solve the mobility challenges in Africa. We want to get people and goods to their destinations hitch-free. It is personal for us because we understand the frustration of epileptic transportation. We are making mobility safe, affordable, accessible, and sustainable through the deployment of high-performance technologies and operators.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer - Activation / Documentation

Job Location: Lokoja, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role & Responsibilities
Documentation:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain a record of all new vehicles delivered to the premises.
	Maintain documentation detailing all setup-related processes from delivery to activation.
	Maintain a record of vehicles within their jurisdiction and manage the renewal process for expired vehicle documents (e.g., plate numbers, insurance).
	Maintain a record of inventory in stores within their jurisdiction.
	Manage and maintain a record of all vehicle VINs upon delivery.


?Vehicle Setup and Activation:


	Ensure the timely setup of vehicles from initial delivery to activation.
	Upload accurate vehicle details into VAMS upon delivery and update until activation.
	Liaise with third-party contractors for painting, branding, and other setup-related processes to ensure prompt readiness.
	Liaise with the Documentation team to ensure vehicle plate numbers, insurance, and other documentation are delivered in time for activation.
	Follow up on the setup process until the vehicle is activated.
	Coordinate sorting and arrangement of vehicles designated for other locations, and follow up until delivery is confirmed.
	Ensure timely resolution of insurance-related matters, including renewals and claims.
	Hand over documentation to Champions once hire-purchase (HP) is completed.


?Inventory Operations:


	Manage inventory records and issue spare parts as required.?


Administrative Functions:


	Manage the departmental float card and petty expenses.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND/BSC in any Engineering discipline.
	2 years fleet management
	Logistics industry preference

title: Job Openings at Outsource Point Limited
content:
Outsource Point Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) NOC Engineer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the NOC Engineer, you will be responsible for monitoring, maintaining, and troubleshooting network systems to ensure optimal performance and uptime.
	You will proactively identify and resolve issues, manage incident escalations, and provide technical support to ensure efficient service delivery.


Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Monitor and manage network performance across all systems and infrastructure
	Perform system administration and troubleshooting on network equipment
	Identify, analyze, and resolve network problems promptly to minimize downtime
	Escalate unresolved issues to higher-level technical teams and ensure timely resolution
	Prepare reports on network performance and service quality metrics.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, or related fields
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in network operations or technical support
	Strong understanding of fixed wireless communication and Cisco network devices
	CCNA/CCNP certification required; proficiency in managing Cisco switches
	Must be available for 24/7 shift rotation; strong communication and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Enterprise Sales Executive (Connectivity Consultant)

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Enterprise Sales Executive, you will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, building client relationships, and driving revenue growth through innovative internet connectivity and enterprise solutions.
	You will manage the full sales cycle, from prospecting to closing deals, while maintaining long-term partnerships.


Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new sales opportunities to expand the company’s customer base
	Develop and implement sales strategies to achieve and exceed targets
	Build and maintain strong relationships with enterprise clients and partners
	Prepare and deliver sales proposals, reports, and performance forecasts
	Provide after-sales support and ensure client satisfaction.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Business Administration, Marketing, or related fields
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in B2B or enterprise sales (telecom or IT industry preferred)
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets
	Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM tools.


Application Closing Date: 21st November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Finance Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Finance Manager, you will be responsible for managing the company’s financial operations, budgeting, and reporting processes.
	You will ensure accurate financial records, monitor cash flow, and provide strategic insights to support business growth and profitability.


Responsibilities


	Oversee daily accounting operations, including payables, receivables, and reconciliations
	Prepare monthly financial statements, budgets, and management reports
	Monitor cash flow, control expenses, and ensure compliance with financial policies
	Support strategic decision-making through financial analysis and forecasting


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in finance or accounting, preferably in the QSR or retail sector
	Strong knowledge of financial reporting, budgeting, and tax compliance
	Proficiency in accounting software and advanced Microsoft Excel skills
	Excellent analytical, communication, and leadership abilities.


Salary
N400,000 - N600,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 21st November, 2025.
